post:
Hi,

<br>
> <center>What is a NAT VPS?</center>
> Network Address Translation (NAT) is the process where a network device, usually a firewall, assigns a public address to a computer (or group of computers) inside a private network. 
> So a VPS that’s utilizing this kind of technology is shortly understand-able as a VPS with shared IPv4.
> It comes with a dedicated IPv6 subnet.
> In low end vps world, the main purpose of NATted VPS is also to make the price as low as possible.
> Most popular OS choices like Ubuntu, Debian and CentOS can be installed from the control panel.
>  
> Shortly it’s just like any common VPS, but it comes with Shared IPv4, not dedicated.
<br>
All plans come with /112 IPv6 Subnet, NAT IPv4 with 20 usable ports + 1 SSH port, Domain Forwarding(host on IPv4 port 80/443)

<center>

------------------

What can you use this kind VPS? Here it is few examples of what you can do with it:

* Host a full-fledged website (w any CMS like Wordpress, Ghost etc) on port 80/443 
* VPN - Most protocols including OpenVPN & Wireguard can be used.
* Proxy (private, protected)
* IRC client/server (IPv6)
* VoiP apps like Teamspeak, Mumble etc.
* Anything you want with native IPv6
* A simple remote terminal with root access, testing scripts & other stuff.
* A light usage remote desktop.
* Distributed database, Web Scrapers etc.
* Many more possibilities....may ask in this thread.

<br>
